reviews.review_msg: Dr. S is a very thoughtful professor. I took her classes for both PSYC 325 and PSYC 382 in the same semester. Her classes are quite heavy - there are a lot of practice assignments (small marks), 3 tests, 1 final project and 1 final exam. Though course material can be challenging at times, Dr. S is SUPERB at explaining concepts.

She is very nice and provides study guides, however, essentially everything she teaches is on it so it's useless. Her exams are quite difficult and it's not clear what should be known. Time is very limited, her exams are basically all short/long answers. When all her students informed her we were extremely rushed she told all of us to learn more.

Great professor, very caring and nice. Adjusted the test grades multiple times since the class average was low and gave people free marks basically. Weekly assignments are easy, term assignment is super easy. Tests consist of 2-3 long answer written questions but are marked quite generously imo and its not that hard at all. Pre-recorded lectures

Dr S is so caring and empathizes with the difficulties of remote instruction. She uses great examples to illustrate points. She lowered the number of questions on the tests after getting our feedback for needing more time. Main issue is the grading scheme; an A-minus starts at 90%, so you'll need to work hard to get into that A-range.

Lesley created a very organized remote learning environment. Her test structure was challenging to adjust to at first, and she does assign a few "homework" tasks for small % but they were great for practice and grade boosts. Her lectures/notes were easy to follow and led to seamless studying with provided study guides. She explained concepts great!

Dr. Schimanski is extremely well prepared, kind and helpful. Her materials in canvas were excellent & she provided clear & detailed instructions every step of the way, for every assignment. Her lectures were fun and interesting, with photos of her dogs. She worked really hard to help the class do well. I would take any of her classes in the future!

I took PSYC325 with Dr. Schimanski during covid and I really enjoyed her course structure as well as how she teaches! Lectures were split up into 5-20min videos discussing each concept so it was easier take in information. You can tell she loves teaching and comes up with fun assignments to learn the material! 10/10 recommend taking a class w/ her

Dr. S is a really nice prof that genuinely cares about her students and them doing well. One of the test averages was low, and she gave a bonus credit assignment to help bring the average back up. She also cares about how her students feel about the class/test difficulty and will accommodate accordingly. She is an awesome prof, highly recommend her

Professor Schimanski is such an awesome prof. She is very easy to understand and generally wants all of her students to do well. The lectures have the same material as the readings so I would suggest to mostly focus on taking lecture notes and just skimming through the textbook. She provides very good feedback. Overall, an amazing prof!

Genuinely wants all of her students to succeed and get the best mark possible. Her assignments and grading are very straightforward. Lectures were asynchronous with optional live lectures times for questions. Tests are quite difficult, but if the class average is quite low for a test she offers chances to boost your marks.

Dr. Schimanski is a great prof! You can tell she really cares about her students and does as much as she can to help everyone succeed. Her lectures are really in-depth and tests are all written and based on lectures. Would definitely take a course with her again. Very organized for it being remote right now :) 10/10 recommend!

Don't take her online. Her TA will give you 60-80% no matter how much you study, she makes you do a ridiculously involved assignment (20 minutes everyday for two months), her lectures are slow and long, and they go right up until the final so you're forced to cram. lowered my Gpa for this joke of a class. Don't take. You will not get an A.

Really cares about students well being and improvement in the class. Super accessible out of class. Had her during online season, when test questions get somewhat confusing she is quick to help clarify. The small activities she posts are beneficial to your tests. Her slides alone carried me through the course. Would join her class again.

I love Dr.S, she always wants all of her students to succeed and get the best mark possible. Her assignments and grading are very straightforward and simple, and her lectures are always very engaging. She gives a lot of examples to connect to the material. Tests are sometimes a little difficult, but she offers chances to boost marks.

DR.S is great, her course is laid out in a very easy way online, the assignments are made to be interesting- The course focuses on behaviour processes and brain substrates of each chapter which can go into further understanding in the textbook. The material seems intimidating but it's not that bad. Dr.S lays it all out in a way that makes sense.

The material is really straightforward, in particular because Dr. S is so organized. She uses really creative and funny examples to illustrate concepts. She genuinely cares about her students and you can get good advice from her at office hours.

I've taken both Psyc 100 and Psyc 201W with Dr. S and she is so caring and sweet! She's clear about what she wants you to learn and expects of you from projects and tests. She tries to incorporate dog pics/videos in her lectures to make them more interesting! Overall, a genuinely lovely person and easy to follow lectures.

Her class was really interesting and she was really nice. I would definitely take another class with her in the future because she was so sweet and understanding, her grading is a little on the tough side but I found the lectures pretty interesting.

Dr. Schimanski is the best prof I've had at SFU. One of the few that actually really cares about her students and goes out of her way to help you. Her lectures are engaging and her tests are super fair, as long as you go to class and use her notes to study you will do well. I also took PSYC 201 with her, and I would take any course she teaches.

She is the most amazing professor I've ever met. She likes what she teaches and helps out the students as much she can. She is so approachable. Her PowerPoint is pretty unclear? But, that's okay anyway, you have to read a book to get better marks. She makes me into the psychology field and I was truly enjoying her class.

If you have experience on statistics courses, this is a easy course for you. Lesley is also a very nice prof and able to explain questions very well. She offered so much help and made sure we did well in this course. Her exams were fair and no trick questions. you are able to bring a cheat-sheet but make sure you copy correct formula

Dr. S is an amazing professor!!! She was extremely kind and shockingly, very thorough with her rubrics. For the massive, semester-long research paper, her rubric broke down exactly what had to be done and provided us with instructions for what to write for each sentence. Lectures can be heavy and the textbook is absolutely necessary!! Hard final!

Dr. Schimanski is definitely one of the kindest professors I have had throughout university so far. She truly cares about her students and wants them to succeed. Always approachable and very informative. She makes what could be a rather dry subject matter pretty interesting. There are biweekly quizzes that aren't super easy but are entirely MC.

Lesley seems to really care about her students. Her lectures a little dry but they're informative as she tries to break down confusing topics. There is quite a bit of writing involved, as you are writing your research paper throughout the semester. Her biweekly quizzes might have some questions straight from the textbook, so keep a lookout on that!

Second time shes been my prof and shes great! Lectures are boring but shes willing to meet and explain concepts in office hours, as well as provides time to go over the projects. Multiple choice quiz every other week, as long as you study the questions in the textbook and lecture slides you'll be fine. make sure to be able to apply the concepts!
so considerate and reasonable, one of those profs that explains things in amazing ways, highly reccommend!
She is lovey and I would love to take another course with her that is not research based. The only problem is that she deducts points very easily when it comes to assignments.

Lectures were hard to follow, but she gave great examples. iClicker quizzes were really important and happened each lecture. Exams were confusing, not really based off of the lecture or textbook (material on exams didn't come from 1 source), almost like the lecture notes were based off of something different

Dr S is very helpful. She is always willing to answer any question you ask, has good examples, and she tries her best to accommodate you if you can't make it to office hours. she deviates from the syllabus quite a bit so don't rely on the syllabus -- but that's cause she tries to give us more time on assignments. Quiz every class so don't skip!

Messy lectures. Textbook is your friend in this course. Don't even look at the lecture notes or go to one. Read the textbook and teach yourself. She cannot even finish the lecture slides nor reviews them before the exams and quizzes. Avoid.

Not a good prof, her lectures were so uninformative and unorganized. She barely had definitions, focused more on questions and examples. Didn't help for exams, so don't bother studying her lecture slides, save yourself the time and just read the textbook. Barely showed up to class or listened to lectures cause it was a waste of time.

Please take PSYC382 with Dr. S. Extremely knowledgeable (Ph.D in neuroscience), but also so approachable. Lectures are engaging: encourages questions , shows videos, etc. Midterms are very fair and makes study guides questions to study from. In Class quizzes too. Would definitely take a class with her again. START ON THE RESEARCH PROPOSAL EARLY.

Dr. Schimanski is a great professor. She is extremely approachable, super nice, and explains concepts clearly. Exams are straight from the notes so if you memorize them you will do great. Definitely take any class she teaches.

Great professor. Very nice and cares about her students a lot. The course was really interesting and exams mostly come from the lectures. The textbook is only good for better understanding and a few study guide questions.

Dr. Schimanski is a great professor! Her explanations are clear and her assignments and tests are fair if you just do the homework. She is also extremely nice to talk to and takes the time to help with homework. I would hands down suggest taking a class with her.
Fair exams and assignments. Clear explanations and super friendly. Our class had a super high average so unfortunately some people got bumped down a grade or so.

She has a soft & quite voice so don't sit in the back, you won't be able to hear her. Textbook only used for tutorial homework, the exams are based on lectures & understanding. Cheat sheet allowed so no need to memorize formulas. The assignments are a little confusing (criteria not very specific), communicate with the ta since they are marking it.

Lesley made this class so much easier and more straightforward than I thought it would be! She explains things really well and is always available if you need extra help. Definitely recommend taking this class with her

Dr. L does a really good job of making the class a chill learning environment, very open to discussion and questions. The class material's quite complex, but she does an excellent job of explaining it and showing the material in multiple forms (e.g. example videos). Tests are MC and SA, and only one (fairly small) term project.
